dict.string: View and manage a sequence of files

notification() { ./_licensed/terminal-notifier/terminal-notifier.app/Contents/MacOS/terminal-notifier -title "WatchList" -message "${1}" } source ./workflowHandler.sh
if [[ ! -d "$(getDataDir)" ]]; then mkdir "$(getDataDir)" fi
echo "{query}" | perl -pe 's/\t/\n/g' >> "$(getDataDir)/towatch.txt" touch "$(getDataDir)/watched.txt"
notification "Added to watchlist"

source ./workflowHandler.sh towatch="$(getDataDir)/towatch.txt" watched="$(getDataDir)/watched.txt"
filetoread=$(sed -n "{query}p" "${towatch}") open "${filetoread}" sed -i '' "{query}d" "${towatch}" echo "${filetoread}" | cat - "${watched}" > "$(getDataDir)/tmp.txt" mv "$(getDataDir)/tmp.txt" "${watched}"

source ./workflowHandler.sh towatch="$(getDataDir)/towatch.txt"
IFS=$'\n'
if [[ -z $(cat ${towatch}) ]]; then echo "<?xml version='1.0'?><items>" echo "<item uuid='none' arg='none' valid='no'>" echo "<title>Play (wlp)</title>" echo "<subtitle>You have no unwatched files</subtitle>" echo "<icon>icon.png</icon>" echo "</item>" echo "</items>" else echo "<?xml version='1.0'?><items>" towatch=$(cat ${towatch}) for file in $(echo "${towatch}" | grep -in ".*{query}.*"); do line="$(echo ${file} | sed 's/:.*//')" file="$(echo ${file} | sed 's/.*://')" filename="$(basename ${file})" echo "<item uuid='${line}' arg='${line}' valid='yes'>" echo "<title><![CDATA[${filename}]]></title>" echo "<subtitle><![CDATA[${file}]]></subtitle>" echo "<icon>icon.png</icon>" echo "</item>" done echo "</items>" fi

source ./workflowHandler.sh towatch="$(getDataDir)/towatch.txt"
IFS=$'\n'
if [[ -z $(cat ${towatch}) ]]; then echo "<?xml version='1.0'?><items>" echo "<item uuid='none' arg='none' valid='no'>" echo "<title>Play (wlp)</title>" echo "<subtitle>You have no unwatched files</subtitle>" echo "<icon>icon.png</icon>" echo "</item>" echo "</items>" else echo "<?xml version='1.0'?><items>" towatch=$(cat ${towatch}) for file in $(echo "${towatch}" | grep -in ".*{query}.*"); do line="$(echo ${file} | sed 's/:.*//')" file="$(echo ${file} | sed 's/.*://')" duration="$(./_licensed/mediainfo/mediainfo --Output='Video;%Duration/String2%' ${file})" filename="$(basename ${file})" echo "<item uuid='${line}' arg='${line}' valid='yes'>" echo "<title><![CDATA[${filename}]]></title>" echo "<subtitle>${duration}</subtitle>" echo "<icon>icon.png</icon>" echo "</item>" done echo "</items>" fi

notification() { ./_licensed/terminal-notifier/terminal-notifier.app/Contents/MacOS/terminal-notifier -title "WatchList" -message "${1}" } source ./workflowHandler.sh towatch="$(getDataDir)/towatch.txt" watched="$(getDataDir)/watched.txt"
filetoread=$(sed -n "{query}p" "${watched}") sed -i '' "{query}d" "${watched}" echo "${filetoread}" | cat - "${towatch}" > "$(getDataDir)/tmp.txt" mv "$(getDataDir)/tmp.txt" "${towatch}"
notification "Marked as unwatched"

source ./workflowHandler.sh watched="$(getDataDir)/watched.txt"
IFS=$'\n'
if [[ -z $(cat ${watched}) ]]; then echo "<?xml version='1.0'?><items>" echo "<item uuid='none' arg='none' valid='no'>" echo "<title>Unwatch (wlu)</title>" echo "<subtitle>You have no watched files</subtitle>" echo "<icon>icon.png</icon>" echo "</item>" echo "</items>" else echo "<?xml version='1.0'?><items>" watched=$(cat ${watched}) for file in $(echo "${watched}" | grep -in ".*{query}.*"); do line="$(echo ${file} | sed 's/:.*//')" file="$(echo ${file} | sed 's/.*://')" filename="$(basename ${file})" echo "<item uuid='${line}' arg='${line}' valid='yes'>" echo "<title><![CDATA[${filename}]]></title>" echo "<subtitle><![CDATA[${file}]]></subtitle>" echo "<icon>icon.png</icon>" echo "</item>" done echo "</items>" fi
Pick a file to mark as unwatched
Open the lists in your default text editor, for manual editing

notification() { ./_licensed/terminal-notifier/terminal-notifier.app/Contents/MacOS/terminal-notifier -title "WatchList" -message "${1}" } source ./workflowHandler.sh watched="$(getDataDir)/watched.txt"
cat "${watched}" | perl -pe 's/\n/\0/' | xargs -0 ./_licensed/trash/trash cat /dev/null > "${watched}"
notification "Watched files were moved to the trash"
Move your watched files to the trash

notification() { ./_licensed/terminal-notifier/terminal-notifier.app/Contents/MacOS/terminal-notifier -title "WatchList" -message "${1}" } source ./workflowHandler.sh watched="$(getDataDir)/watched.txt"
filetoread=$(sed -n "{query}p" "${watched}") url=$(mdls -name kMDItemWhereFroms "${filetoread}" | sed -n "2p" | tr -d ' "\n') echo -n "${url}" | pbcopy
notification "Copied link to clipboard"

source ./workflowHandler.sh watched="$(getDataDir)/watched.txt"
IFS=$'\n'
if [[ -z $(cat ${watched}) ]]; then echo "<?xml version='1.0'?><items>" echo "<item uuid='none' arg='none' valid='no'>" echo "<title>Share (wls)</title>" echo "<subtitle>You need to use this with watched files</subtitle>" echo "<icon>icon.png</icon>" echo "</item>" echo "</items>" else echo "<?xml version='1.0'?><items>" watched=$(cat ${watched}) for file in $(echo "${watched}" | grep -in ".*{query}.*"); do line="$(echo ${file} | sed 's/:.*//')" file="$(echo ${file} | sed 's/.*://')" url="$(mdls -name kMDItemWhereFroms ${file} | sed -n "2p" | tr -d ' "\n')" if [[ -z "${url}" ]]; then url="This item has no metadata on where it's from" valid="no" else valid="yes" fi filename="$(basename ${file})" echo "<item uuid='${line}' arg='${line}' valid='${valid}'>" echo "<title><![CDATA[${filename}]]></title>" echo "<subtitle><![CDATA[${url}]]></subtitle>" echo "<icon>icon.png</icon>" echo "</item>" done echo "</items>" fi
Get URL from where item is from

notification() { ./_licensed/terminal-notifier/terminal-notifier.app/Contents/MacOS/terminal-notifier -title "WatchList" -message "${1}" } source ./workflowHandler.sh watched="$(getDataDir)/watched.txt"
filetoread=$(sed -n "{query}p" "${watched}") url=$(mdls -name kMDItemWhereFroms "${filetoread}" | sed -n "2p" | tr -d ' "\n') open "${url}"
